title: Mid-1800s Advertising Typefaces
content:
Looking to recreate these two samples, and any advice on the various faces would be a big help.

Thanks in advance for your time and expertise!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203191123im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HowGamblersWin2_4422.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203191123im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HowGamblersWin116_4937.jpg)
author: malbright

comments.content: Hi Michael. Keeping in mind that these may not be available digitally, [Consort Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203191123/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/red_rooster/consort_condensed/?sample_text=CHESS%20AND%20CARD%20GAMES) might be your best bet for the big type on the top sample with [Excelsior](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203191123/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/excelsior_std_ot_virtual/?sample_text=handy%20Manual%20of%20all%20the%20known&sample_size=24) for text.

The second headline face reminds me of [Romana](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203191123/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/urw/romana/?sample_text=MORE%20LIGHT%20asonic%20Ritual), but that's certainly not it.

Thanks, Stephen.

I know I've seen similars to the "Masonic Ritual" typeface, but none come to mind. The "R" reminds me of Parkinson, but otherwise it's not all that close.

For the sans, the best match I can think of is [FF Bau](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203191123/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_bau/?sample_text=DUNCAN%E2%80%99S). Or [Maple](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203191123/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/process/maple_ot/?sample_text=DUNCAN%E2%80%99S) for more flavor.
